meanings.definition: A medieval musical instrument resembling a trombone.
meanings.sent1: The minstrel played a merry tune on the sackbut.
meanings.sent2: The sackbut added a rich tone to the ensemble.
meanings.sent3: The sackbut player accidentally tooted a funny note.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the sackbut echoed through the hall like a regal call.
meanings.sent5: The shiny sackbut gleamed under the stage lights.

meanings.sent3: Getting sackbutted was a wake-up call for him.
meanings.sent4: The decision to sackbut him was like cutting dead weight.
meanings.sent5: The company had to sackbut him to maintain productivity.
